\• Everyone has the right to freedom of peaceful assembly and association.

 	• No one may be compelled to belong to an association.

 	• The exercise of these rights may be subject to certain restrictions, but these shall only be such as are provided by law and are necessary in a democratic society in the interests of national security or public safety, public order, the protection of public health or morals or the protection of the rights and freedoms of others.

 	• The right to freedom of association includes the right to form and join trade unions for the protection of one's interests.

 	• The right to freedom of peaceful assembly includes the right to gather for peaceful demonstrations, protests, and meetings, and to express one's opinions in a public forum without fear of persecution or retaliation.
